intro: Lachenalia hirta, commonly known as the woolly lachenalia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its rosette of linear, hairy leaves. The plant produces tall, branched stems that bear clusters of bell-shaped, white or pinkish flowers. It thrives in well-drained, sandy soils and requires full sun exposure. Lachenalia hirta is often cultivated for its ornamental value and unique appearance.
